website_summaries.verdict: A no-frills, reliable orbit sander with enough power to tackle most home improvement and hobbyist tasks. Its biggest flaw is a tricky dust collector attachment.
pros: Good basic design and acceptable power for a home-user grade sander
Operates smoothly without too much vibration or noise
cons: Some users are unhappy with the ergonomic design, finding the edges bite into the hand during use
Dust collector fills quickly and can fall off easily if not properly seated within the O ring
On/off switch can be difficult to engage
Power cord is rigid and “flops around.”

customer_reviews.title: Hot little bugger
customer_reviews.text: Hard to hold without blocking the air vents. Even when not blocking the air vents while holding it the sander gets extremely hot in a matter of minutes. I feel like this one is destined to die in less than 6 months like my other sanders. But then again this is why I bought a cheaper one this time. It is really disconcerting how hot it gets though. Like I need to wear oven mitts to use this thing hot. Like I found my grandpa's all metal corded drill let's use it as a space heater hot. But eh it sands like every other orbital I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Sobchex

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend hooking up a shop vac to the dust collection ...
customer_reviews.text: Work horse! Have used this as part of several large sanding jobs and it just keeps going. Quality tool! Helpful Hint! If you want to really control the dust, I would recommend hooking up a shop vac to the dust collection attachment on the sander. I am using a cheap Home Depot "Bucket Head Shop Vac" snapped onto a 5 gallon bucket. Remove the dust collection bag from the sander and set aside. The Bucket Head hose slides onto dust outlet, secure with a little tape. Run the vacuum at the same time you are sanding. This GREATLY reduces the amount of dust created.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum attachment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old Dewalt random sander because I needed the vacuum attachment. It works as expected and does a fairly good job of collecting most of the dust when attached to a vacuum. I have not really tried using it with the included bag collector, so cannot speak to that feature. The hook & loop pad works well. An added bonus is that the dust collection attachment also fits the Dewalt. Who knew?

customer_reviews.title: Some design issues
customer_reviews.text: The on/off switch is difficult to operate. The rocker switch should be a little bigger and easier to palpate the high side from the low side. I find myself fumbling with it each time I turn it on or off. Also the Velcro does not keep the pad secure, it shifts about a 1/4" after a few minutes of use with the Amazon suggested off-brand disks. Maybe this will improve with the Porter Cable disks I ordered. The dust collector works better than my old Porter Cable with the 5 hole pad.

customer_reviews.title: works great

customer_reviews.title: Very good sander and has decent power
customer_reviews.text: Very good sander and has decent power. I substituted the PC base for the sticky pads an exact match as I dont like hook n loop. When that happens the sander motor will not have enough power to spin the entire disc against the surface, so repack the standard 6202 bearing or get anew one. The bearing is inside 2 aluminum supports that split in two. Motor is well balanced and smooth in your hand.

Porter-Cable's 382 5-inch random orbit sander is ideal for surface prep before painting or staining, smoothing seams where materials meet, or removing old coats of varnish (view larger). The Porter-Cable 382 5-inch random orbit sander is equipped with a slew of features that make it ideal for any number of DIY and professional sanding applications. Ideal for fine sanding and finishing work thanks to its random-pattern sanding that doesn’t leave swirls or gouges in the material—be it metal, wood or composite—the 382 random orbit sander provides maximum sanding speed for smooth finishes. Porter-Cable’s Controlled Finishing System allows for controllable pad speed, especially during startup. Whether you’re preparing a surface for a coat of paint or stain, smoothing seams where pieces of material meet, or removing olds coats of paint or varnish from furniture, the 382 is the lightweight yet powerful random orbit sander to get the job done.

POWERFUL SANDER FOR FINE FINISHING
The 382 5-inch random orbit sander is equipped with a 1.9-amp motor that is capable of 12,000 OPM, allowing you to power through sanding applications big and small to as fine a finish as you need. Accepting 5-inch 8-hole hook-and-loop sandpaper, the 382 utilizes Porter-Cable’s Controlled Finishing System to maintain controllable pad speed and minimize gouging, making for a consistent finish and extra-smooth surface upon project completion. Its sealed 100-percent ball-bearing construction makes it sturdy and durable, but its lightweight design (it weighs just 3 pounds) and dual-plane counterbalanced fan reduce user fatigue. The switch is dust-sealed to prevent dust ingestion, increasing the switch’s working lifespan and ensuring long-term use job after job.

ABOUT PORTER-CABLE
With more than 100 years of experience producing quality and performance-driven tools, Porter-Cable is a leading manufacturer and marketer of professional-grade cordless and corded power tools, equipment, and accessories. Known for industry-changing innovation, Porter-Cable introduced the world’s first helical drive circular saw, portable band saw, and portable belt sander.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
One Porter-Cable 382 5-inch random orbit sander and one operating manual.

HIGHLIGHTS
 * Compact and lightweight random orbit sander ideal for DIY and professional applications
 * Equipped with a 1.9-amp motor and capable of 12,000 OPM
 * Dual-plane counterbalanced fan to reduce user fatigue over extended run time
 * Accepts 5-inch 8-hole hook-and-loop sandpaper
 * Backed by a 90-day money-back guarantee, a one-year free service contract, and a three-year limited warranty
